image.altText: The black and white image is a close-up of Tina, wearing makeup, her eyes closed and her hand pressed to her palm.

props.synopsis: The new portrait comes in two parts — known as a diptych — and will be on display at the National Portrait Gallery from September 6 to mark Tina Arena's 50-year career.

title.children: Artist says Tina Arena became 'like a sister' while sitting for portrait

image.altText: A woman walking into court with another woman.

props.synopsis: Canberra's only prison breached the human rights of a former Aboriginal detainee by illegally strip-searching her while she was held in remand there in 2021, the ACT Supreme Court has found.

title.children: Aboriginal woman's human rights breached by illegal strip search in jail

image.altText: Skiers and paramedics gathered on a ski slope.

props.synopsis: The 22-year-old's death at Thredbo comes weeks after a snowboarder died at Perisher.

title.children: Young man dies on Snowy Mountains ski slope

image.altText: Composite

props.synopsis: Your health is at stake as climate change impacts deepen, but it’s not too late to do something about it, according to the new chair of the ACT Climate Council. And some Australians making hyperlocal changes are already reaping surprising benefits.

title.children: 'Hyperlocal' eco-choices leaving Australians healthier and better off

image.altText: A street lined with businesses closed off with police tape, with three uniformed officers outside one of the businesses.

props.synopsis: Seven men have been arrested and another man is in custody in relation to a double stabbing in Queanbeyan last month, in what NSW Police say was a targeted attack connected to outlaw motorcycle gang activity.

title.children: Police arrest seven men over 'targeted' Queanbeyan double stabbing

image.altText: High Court of Australia, building, generic

props.synopsis: The man is one of three people who were slated to be removed to Nauru in February under the government's newly minted agreement with the island nation, which was stepped up at the weekend with a $400 million deal.

title.children: Iraqi asylum seeker slated for removal to Nauru loses High Court challenge

image.altText: Dickson Library

props.synopsis: An independent working group has found systemic issues within Libraries ACT, including that workplace culture is affecting morale and contributing to increased closures.

title.children: 'A persistent breakdown in trust': Scathing report into Canberra's libraries

image.altText: A man in his 30s is speaking while holding a mic

props.synopsis: Gary Stevenson achieved his childhood dream of becoming rich by his mid-20s. The 39-year-old now spends most of his time campaigning against the wealthy.

title.children: The rich are 'squeezing out' ordinary people and this millionaire aims to stop it

image.altText: A man with short brown hair wearing a black tshirt is kneeling down and patting a dog.

props.synopsis: Police have confirmed the missing remains found by a member of the public in scrubland east of Port Lincoln are that of alleged murder victim Julian Story. Warning: This story contains content some readers may find distressing.

title.children: Testing confirms alleged murder victim's remains, police say

image.altText: A woman celebrates after winning a pole vault competition

props.synopsis: World and Olympic champion pole vaulter Nina Kennedy has had her hopes of defending her title at the World Athletics Championships dashed, with the Australian forced to pull out with injury.

title.children: Pole vault champion Nina Kennedy pulls out of World Athletics Championships

image.altText: Angie Bell

props.synopsis: Shadow Environment Minister Angie Bell says the Coalition hasn't commissioned its own modelling to help make a decision about its energy policy.

title.children: Coalition hasn't commissioned modelling to help form energy policy: Bell — as it happened

image.altText: A composite image with headshots of Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: The prime minister says the pair had a "warm and constructive" conversation about trade, critical minerals and shared security interests.

title.children: PM says he had 'warm and constructive' conversation with Trump

image.altText: A cartoon character screenshot from the video game hollow knight silksong

props.synopsis: After years of silence, Team Cherry has released their sequel to one of the most successful Australian-made games of all time, which is expected to break records.

title.children: Australian-made Hollow Knight: Silksong crashes global stores on launch

image.altText: A big white iceberg hangs into the sea

props.synopsis: A colossal iceberg ranked among the oldest and largest ever recorded is crumbling apart in warm Antarctic waters, and could disappear within weeks.

title.children: One of the biggest icebergs ever seen could be 'gone in weeks'

image.altText: A person wearing medical gloves draws a vaccine from a bottle with a syringe

props.synopsis: Congo has 28 suspected cases of Ebola, but the World Health Organization expects that number to increase.

title.children: Congo declares another Ebola outbreak after 15 deaths

image.altText: Belarusian tennis star Aryna Sabalenka throws her head back and roars in celebration after winning a match.

props.synopsis: Women's world number one Aryna Sabalenka is one win from defending her US Open title as she beats American star Jessica Pegula in a rematch of last year's final.

title.children: Sabalenka beats hometown heroine Pegula to reach US Open final

image.altText: Trish Gyler cleans her teeth

props.synopsis: A creditor’s report into Supercare Dental and Cosmetics Tuggerah reveals almost $3 million in unsecured creditor claims with little chance patients will be able to recoup their money.

title.children: Australians left with 'ugly' teeth and no super are unlikely to see their money again

image.altText: Diane Keaton (centre) in a grey suit jacket and checked scarf holding an oscar, surrounded by men in suits.

props.synopsis: Giorgio Armani's name has become synonymous with the red carpet, thanks to his close relationship with the stars.

title.children: Diane Keaton's jacket started a love affair between Armani and the stars

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: Australian shares are following global markets higher as traders become more convinced the US Federal Reserve will resume cutting interest rates this month. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX gains as global interest rate fears subside

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Sydney's median house prices could rise over $150k by end of 2026
ASX 200 best and worst performers so far

image.altText: Min Aung Hlaing shakes hands with Narendra Modi

props.synopsis: Nearly five years ago, Myanmar's military seized power, plunging the country into a bloody civil war that left the junta internationally isolated. Now, with no end to the conflict in sight, Myanmar is going to the polls again.

title.children: Myanmar's junta grabbed power in a coup. Now the country is going to the polls

image.altText: Drone shot of eleven fuel tanks next to harbour

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has exempted 11 massive US military fuel tanks built unlawfully on Darwin Harbour from needing occupancy certification.

title.children: NT minister exempts unlawfully built US military fuel tanks from certification

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in a suit with purple tie sitting in parliament

props.synopsis: Despite being in an overwhelmingly dominant position politically, Anthony Albanese sounded quite tetchy this week.

title.children: Dan Andrews's red carpet walk in Beijing put Albanese on the spot

image.altText: David Byrne wearing a pink breast suit poses with left arm resting on blue table top, peering over his own shoulder upward

props.synopsis: David Byrne is still asking a lot of big questions about human behaviour with his colourful, curious new solo album, Who Is the Sky?

title.children: David Byrne on why kindness and empathy is the new punk

image.altText: A man and a woman bump bellies together.

props.synopsis: Writer and performer Lorin Clarke ropes in the cream of Australia's comedy crop to celebrate the life and work of her father, John, in her new documentary.

title.children: But Also John Clarke is a tender look at Australia's greatest satirist

image.altText: An illustration of a large stadium in a green park near the CBD.

props.synopsis: However, the heritage listing won't do much, as the state government has already passed legislation which allows it to bypass planning laws for Olympic venues.

title.children: Heritage listing expanded at proposed Olympic stadium site

image.altText: An accident scene with police and vehicles.

props.synopsis: Police say the two women were struck by a vehicle on the Hume Freeway at Craigieburn on Thursday night.

title.children: Two women killed while trying to help injured animal on Melbourne freeway

image.altText: A Fronius home battery and inverter setup.

props.synopsis: Home battery installers in Western Australia say they're collectively owed millions of dollars in rebates and loans from a government scheme.

title.children: As batteries boom, installers are boycotting one state's rebate scheme

image.altText: A sad child sits in a chair with their face hidden behind their hair

props.synopsis: There can be a range of clues parents can pick up on when their child is being bullied. Here's how to approach it with your child, and how to advocate for them at school.

title.children: What if your child is being bullied, but the school won't act?

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy looking on as Emmanuel Macron speaks at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The forces would be deployed on day one of any peace deal between Ukraine and Russia, aiming to prevent another invasion of the country.

title.children: Coalition of 26 countries commit to Ukraine post-war peacekeeping force

image.altText: A reddish full moon.

props.synopsis: A total lunar eclipse, also known as a "blood moon", will be visible across all of Australia next week. Here's what you need to know to get the best view and snap the best photo.

title.children: Australia is about to get our only total lunar eclipse for 2025

image.altText: A colourised photo of a Tasmanian tiger.

props.synopsis: Even after a long life, Peggie Bassett can still remember the guttural growl and striking scent of the last known thylacine as it prowled its concrete enclosure.

title.children: Peggie saw a thylacine as a child. She wouldn't ever want to 'go back and see it'

image.altText: A smashed cable car can be seen on a steep road.

props.synopsis: A maintenance tender for the 140-year-old funicular that crashed in Lisbon on Wednesday, killing 16 people, was cancelled earlier this week because the bids were too expensive.

title.children: Maintenance tender scrapped days before deadly Lisbon cable car crash

image.altText: A man lays in a hospital bed, with his leg bandaged and attached to a brick

props.synopsis: Israel's planned military offensive to take Gaza City is threatening thousands of hospital patients who cannot evacuate or have no place else to go.

title.children: Broken leg wrapped with bandages and bricks: Why the injured cannot evacuate Gaza City

image.altText: A woman in dark blue football kit, running.

props.synopsis: Matildas superstar Sam Kerr is named to play for Chelsea this weekend in the Women's Super League opener.

title.children: Kerr's long-awaited return arrives as coach confirms Chelsea selection

image.altText: Three men in suits walk in a row

props.synopsis: It was another huge week of news. Did you catch it all? Test your memory here.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A viral Trump rumour, an ex-politician under fire and de Minaur's bad luck
